Reviews.Title: “Good city-hotel”
Reviews.Author: HugoMia
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good beds, good breakfast. Excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Family Suite”
Reviews.Author: PamandBarry0826
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Melia. It was a beautiful hotel, the staff were very warm, and we enjoyed the breakfast buffet. The proximity to the Metro cannot be beat, it made our travels around Madrid incredibly easy. The only drawback that we had was that we had a Family Suite and it was not what we thought. It really is just a regular hotel room with an extra bed in it and the extra bed was a little short for our son. The room itself was no bigger than a regular hotel room either so it was close quarters. So, it is something for travelers with families to be aware of.

Reviews.Title: “three stars on some design aspects, minus three on service”
Reviews.Author: Finke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights for a business meeting. There are many good things to say about this hotel and if all stars align you might have a very enjoyable stay in this wonderful city, but I just happened to hit the low notes, which makes me never want to come back to this place. The good things: 1. beautiful lobby and hallway designs, really well done cross-over of modern and classical accents. 2. in pinciple beautifully modern designed and well functioning guest rooms as far as the bare room design and fixtures go. 3. rich breakfast menu. The not so good things: 1. small dungeon pool in the dark basement with terrible service (off note there is a pool picture in their prospectus - no idea were that was taken but hardly in that pothole). 2. ill-ventilated tiny gym with juck-dirty barely functioning equipment. There are up to four people hanging out around the gym who seam like hotel staff but none is doing anything but chatting. Not even spray and paper to clean off the layers of rotting sweat on the treadmill. Since the equipment looked like that, I didn't even dare to go into the hot-tub or pool. The gym is hot, has no airflow / ventilator, and the ceiling is very low. If you are 190 / 6'5'' - don't even think about getting on the treadmill. 3. there are three 8 person elevators of which one didn't work a considerable period. The eights person brings luggage and the elevator stops = eight Standard Europeans without luggage = 75kg basta => plan at least 10 minutes for one trip up or down during "rush hour". 4. The breakfast room had 2 service staff - good luck getting that coffee. 5. the room windows don't close appropriately and whine all night if there is wind; naturally they are also pretty useless as noise insulators. 6. Most aggravating: guest rooms on level 2 and 4 are to be considered asylums for the hearing impaired. If your ear is doing what it's supposed to do, the staff will keep you up all night, guaranteed. There are meeting rooms on level 1 and 3 and chairs, tables, any kind of equipment are per strictest rules only moved during night time. Now, what's important to consider here is that we are taking stone/marble floors and steel frame tables and chairs which are by default moved not by lifting them up and carrying them but by dragging them under the maximum noise development possible from one room to the next. 7. staff behaved dishonest to me: at check in I was told that my room was facing the street but quiet; when I hadn't yet figured out that the commotion was coming from the conference levels the hotel representative responding to my desperate call wanted to make me believe that it was just the occasional street traffic noise; when I went downstairs where the tables and chairs were thrown around I was told that they apologized but that they were done now (that was until I left) by the time I reached my room they were already back in full swing; when I came to the front desk to change rooms the next day, which was arranged by our meeting organizer, I was told that the hotel was sold out and that I had to stay where I was; when being assertive, suddenly a room opened up and happened to be clean, facing to the quieter side of the hotel and on a higher floor, several flights up from the conference area. 8. The meeting break service was dreadful. The coffee never drinkable, the hot water always cold, the sodas always warm.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: goingnowhere87
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big and comfortable with nice amenities, I only had the chance to stay one night and left very early in the morning so couldn't take advantage of the hotel but in general the staff was friendly the location is very good, with the subway station just across the street, 15 min walk to Paseo del Prado and 5 min walk to Plaza del Sol so the location could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in one of the rooms on the lower floors if you want a good nights sleep!!”
Reviews.Author: KTaylor55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Easter weekend for a one night stay following a trip to Salamanaca. We arrived around 7pm and went out to eat not returning until about 11pm. We were staying in room 210 which overlooked Calle de Princesa and could clearly hear the traffic on our return but assumed it would die down. This was not the case and in fact the exceptionally loud traffic noise continued right through the night until the very early hours 5/6am which is round about the time we actually managed to get an hours sleep!! As we were travelling back to the UK the following day and had travelled extensively all week, we needed to get a good nights sleep, but that was not the case at this Melia hotel. I mentioned this at the reception when checking out but the member of staff seemed either disinterested or it was maybe a common complaint. Earlier in the week we had stayed at ME Melia overlooking Plaza Santa Ana and although the rooms were smaller it was a more peaceful and quiet hotel. I would suggest if you want a good nights sleep, surely a necessary requirement, stay here or even better stay at Hotel Urban where we stayed at the beginning of our trip to Madrid - perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for great hotel”
Reviews.Author: FinallyWoken
Reviews.Content: We got the room for €110/night including breakfast on Easter weekend. The breakfast was so glorious. The room is tiny but adequate with free wifi. We were put on 12th fl with a good view of the city. The gym is small but complete. The staffs were friendly. The location is in a main but quite street, only a few minutes from Gran Via. There's a public parking spot right outside the hotel. The only "complaint" I have - if I'm being overcritical - is that on 2nd day the housekeeping put 2 bottles of shampoo and no bath gel, and cleaned up our room even though we left the do not disturb sign on the door. Would definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: yeomanie
Reviews.Content: Clean, stylish, great food, friendly and professional staff, really great! One negative was the size of the room (709) - I am 1m93 tall and found the room a little claustrophobic.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good (with some issues)”
Reviews.Author: Avargasil
Reviews.Content: The hotel is stylish, the lobby is both attractive and beautiful with interesting art pieces in display. The rooms are comfortable with a peculiar design the same for the corridors. Service is good, location is very good, breakfast is fine. Lifts are small and slow, you can wait a lot to get into a crowded lift, or wait for the next. The gym is too small, without air condition, crowded with machines the should require three times the space. The swimming pool is small and opens from 08:00 to 22:00, who can go swim with that kind of limitations? I wanted to check the sauna but I was denied access because I was dressed, well I just wanted to check... The price is good also, so if you don't care about doing some sport before going to work, is a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and stylish hotel”
Reviews.Author: CheshireDave33
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a 4 star hotel in a great location. worth paying extra for rooms with a view as you can see the Royal Palace. Smart lobby with nice seating. Rooms are comfortable with great beds and pillows. Didnt eat here as there are lots of great restaurants in Madrid. The plus point for this hotel is it is opposite the Ventura Rodriguz metro station making it easy to get into central Madrid (Puerto del sol is 3 stops)

Reviews.Title: “What a great way to start a three week trip!”
Reviews.Author: LuAnn7777
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Madrid and I can't say enough good things about the attentive staff. I flew in from Seattle via Philadelphia and looked like 90 miles of bad road when I showed up at 9AM on Saturday. The desk clerk (wish I'd gotten his name!) was kind enough to stow my bags, direct me to the best breakfast buffet outside of the old MGM Grand in Reno and quickly make up a room for me that was vacated by an American airline crew. The room was spacious and clean and the view from the 11th floor was amazing. I read previous reviews and saw the comments about the funky lights and lack of customer service. The lights were weird but tolerable and I saw no evidence of anything but 5 star customer service during my four days there. The food was very, very good and I reintroduced saturated fats into my diet in a big way (note to self - check cholesterol soon). The aforementioned breakfast is worth the money and try the caffe con leche for that fabulous caramel jolt until anywhere else. I got a kick out of the very young bartender who made me a "perfect martini" which consisted solely of vodka and crushed ice, with a side of Gummi bears. Not that I'm complaining.... This central location is perfect for getting around the city. The neighborhood is safe and surrounded by lots of shops, restaurants and as many Starbuck's as my office in Seattle! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to treat themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service improved, but past flaws remain the same”
Reviews.Author: MadAmerican
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Melia Princesa last year and wrote a review where I described the good points (quite a lot) and the bad ones (not so many, but there were some). One year later and things have not changed much. I found customer service to be better than last time, the girl at reception was nice and her colleague who provided me with a map the following day was also very helpful. No complaints on this regard, which was actually the major flaw I found last year. I also tried the restaurant this time and the food (a mixture of western and asian styles) was pretty good, with big portions and, as expected, a big price too. This was not a problem, though, as we had a discount coupon for 40 euros which we promptly used with the lunch, so it actually ended up being a bargain! The problem was, again, in the very nice but not that functional room. And there's not much that can be done about it... The hotel was refurbished in 2008 and it's pretty obvious they won't do it again in some time, so it is what it is: I'll say it again, the room is really nice and modern, the bed huge and comfy... but the light switches are very confusing (I lost count of how many times I unintentionally turned the bathroom's lights out while my wife was in there, and also woke her up a couple of times when I switched the wrong one in the middle of the night...) and washing one's hands require more flexibility in the wrists than I actually have at my age. If you can overlook this, and the fact that there was some visible mould in quite a few parts of the bathtub (no big deal for me... It appeared in my bathtub at home too and I know how bloody hard it is to remove, if at all), it is still a very good hotel, with a great breakfast and in a fine location. My personal circumstances will probably prevent me from going to Madrid again next year but, If I can, I will likely choose Princesa again.

Reviews.Title: “Good City Centre Hotel”
Reviews.Author: grinch99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night on a business trip at the end of January. Hotel is in a great location in the heart of the City, just 2 minutes walk from the Gran Via & Plaza Espana. Despite being so centrally located, I did find my hotel room fairly quiet, it did help I was located on the top floor (12th) but my room did overlook Gran Princesa, the views of Madrid & the surrounding area were breathtaking. My room was large with plenty of amenities although waiting for hot water for the shower was something I wasnt expecting, lack of English speaking channels on the TV was a disappointment but not an issue for one night. I didnt eat in the restaurant but the breakfast choice was excellent with plenty of choice in a large dining area, the staff were very friendly & check in & out was very efficient. I would stay in this hotel gain whether on a business or leisure trip

Reviews.Title: “Melia Madrid Princesa - a cool place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights a the Melia Madrid Princesa and it was a great experience. The hotel has a really "cool" feel throughout the property. The lounges are nice and comfortable and the staff was very friendly and helpful, especially to a non-spanish speaking American! I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5* on the outside”
Reviews.Author: traveltipschris
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business last week for a couple of nights and it was very compfy. I have to say it looked like a 1960's office block on the outside but probably a 4* on the inside. There rooms were very nice and the beds compfy. The staff were very helpful. I also went to El Club Allard for dinner which is less than a 5 minute walk away. Quite outstanding food. for the price at £140 pounds I thought it very good and werepositioned. Chris

Reviews.Title: “Loved my room!”
Reviews.Author: Cathy D
Reviews.Content: I loved my room, and the bathroom was very luxurious! My room was very funky, stylish, and beautiful. The hotel was lovely. The location was great in Madrid. The staff was fairly friendly. I had trouble with my window and a maintenance person literally came within a minute from my call to the front desk. It was a good stay for a 5 star but the staff could have been more friendly and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs-up for the unbeatable location, thumbs-down for the lack of view and ill-mannered maid service”
Reviews.Author: q-sto
Reviews.Content: Overall I was satisfied with my weekend stay, despite a very bad late check-out experience. I chose this hotel for its unbeatable central location - a mere ten-minute-walk to Plaza de Espana and Gran Via. Metro station "Ventura Rodriguez" is directly under the hotel while both stations "Arguelles" and "Plaza de Espana" are very close nearby. Booked my stay on Melia own website - booking process quick and easy, I opted for a Premium room at 145EUR excluding breakfast. Check-in quite satisfying - the receptionist on duty was welcoming and friendly. Premium room on the 2nd floor - I found it modern and quiet enough. Many amenities were available: individual air-conditioning, large desk, quite comfortable King-size bed. Other goodies included a comprehensive media equipment (flatscreen TV, DVD/CD player, USB ports), design sofa, coffee-making facilities. All equipment were working properly. The bathroom layout is very strange as it is split in two rooms: the first one includes two sinks but also the closets (!), while WC and bath are located in the second room! Bath and WC spotlessly clean and with many amenities including dental and shaving kits. On the downside the Melia website is quite misleading as it advertises "very bright rooms, all with views over the city" for Premium rooms. It was definitely NOT the case as my room looked over some emergency stairs and a narrow side street - very disappointing. Breakfast buffet was a bit expensive, therefore I preferred to eat outside. Efficient room service at very reasonable prices - I ordered some tapas for dinner (Iberian croquettes, bacalao fritters) which were quite tasty. The end of my stay was unfortunately let down by a very ILL-MANNERED maid service. I had asked for and been granted a late check-out until 15:00. I returned to my room at 13:30. Despite the "Do not disturb" sign, I found that half of the room had already been cleaned up! There were already new towels and soaps in the bathroom; on the opposite bed sheets had been stripped out but were still laying on the floor. More disturbingly I missed some of my toiletries and Madrid city maps that I wanted to keep. Fortunately I had put my cash and travel documents in the locked safe - what if I had not?! I complained about that during the check-out process. But the receptionist just smiled and shrugged away. I guess this might be a common occurence. However, as I am willing to pay extra for a Premium room, I also expect to be treated accordingly. This poor late check-out experience cast a shadow on an overall good stay in Madrid. All in all I can recommend this hotel for its unbeatable central location. However remember to always lock your valuables in the safe as the "Do not disturb" sign does not prevent anybody from entering your room.

Reviews.Title: “Location - the advantage”
Reviews.Author: Anonnymouse888
Reviews.Content: Renovated in an unusal somewhat 'over-the-top' modern style with eccentric lighting scheme; small rooms with nice bathrooms; staff were pleasant. We stayed over New Year period and very little information was available from the hotel about openings/closings of restaurants and so on in Madrid which made planning difficult. Hotel pool was closed New Years day due to the 'holiday' which seemed a little odd. Location is probably the high point of the hotel - next to a metro stop and walking distance to Plaza Espana and Gran Via. A short walk to the good shopping district of Arguelles and a short metro hop to Salamanca district and the fabulous Calle Serrano. Hidden in the backstreets behind the hotel are some interesting tapas bars and the stylish Quintana 30 Restaurant in Calle Quintana which serves good Basque food and has a fine wine list.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Tarek M
Reviews.Content: Melia is located in the heart of Madrid, close to everything I wanted to see, I only had on day to see as much as possible of Madrid as part of my business trip. Rooms are clean, seems recently renovated, good amenities, limited selection of TV channels, good room service and friendly staff and concierge. Will stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately a miss”
Reviews.Author: zeczeczec
Reviews.Content: The good - location next to metro and on avenida princesa. The bad. Noise was incredible. Howling wind if it was blowing. Unbelievable traffic noise. Difficult to sleep even with ear plugs. Bad design. Someone should have reined in the interior designers as design trumps functionality and sense. Glass doors on bathroom meant noise and lighting shared with the room. Ungainly shower/tub controls. Pointless lighted glass top bedside table that went through full spectrum of colors. Decor in general like a sixties film about the future. Spotty maid service. Didn't replace kleenex for four days. Nice breakfast selection, however, the egg/omelette station was unmanned regardless what time we showed the entire week of our stay. Poor English skills amongst the staff and not particularly helpful when they did understand. The stock responses for any question seemed to be "up/down the road, take the metro, I don't know." Overall, too many problems and other options to warrant a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms - good location”
Reviews.Author: LooeMan
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, fully up to Melia standards. The rooms, even the standard one like ours, are excellent. Lots of lighting options, good temperature control, and excellent bathroom and dressing room facilities. The breakfast buffet is superb. A very good location, just a few minutes walk from Plaza d'Espana and Gran Via, 20 minutes from Puerta del Sol. It is next to a metro station, and only a few minutes walk up Calle Princesa is the excellent shopping district of Arguelles, where you will also find the historic bar-restaurant, Manolo, which is reviewed separately. Our only complaint is that bar prices in the hotel are a bit over the top, but what can you expect in a 5 star luxury hotel. There is a little traffic noise, but acceptable for a city centre. Overall this hotel is good value if you can book it on one of the Melua group deals or special offers.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel; good centralised location”
Reviews.Author: chapter1_andy
Reviews.Content: What I loved about this hotel: 1) 2 minutes walk from Ventura Rodriguez metro station 2) To travel to the Santiago Bernabeu, this would be a good location for hotel whether by Metro or by bus (half an hour) 3) There is a convenience store that opens till late at night (VIPS) approximately 2-3 streets away 4) You can walk to Gran Via which is a shopping area from here (10-15mins walk) 5) The buffet breakfast has a huge spread! 6) Gym, clinic, spa, salon are all located at Level -1, making the hotel a one-stop shop. Business centre was located at The Level. What I didn't like about this hotel 1) There are 2 sinks in the bedroom I had; tap angles felt awkward 2) Pipes seem to burst frequently, and I had an awkward situation of not being able to flush for almost an hour 3) Bathtub angle felt awkward; no shower curtain but a piece of glass is used to prevent water splashing to the floor 4) Charges - was told on checkout that I had consumed 2 bottles of water. However, those 2 bottles of water were brought by my ownself; manager was kind enough to waive the charges 5) Wifi service keeps disconnecting; I had to repeatedly enter my wifi password to access the internet 6) The lift is a little strange; it doesn't seem to operate that frequently with higher floors (I was staying at the 9th floor and it took ages for the lift to come) 7) Limited English speaking hotel staff; but didn't really bother me as I sort of figured out what was needed.

Reviews.Title: “center of Madrid, very comfy”
Reviews.Author: davidrusseleg
Reviews.Content: I've been to Melia twice, the hotel is really great. it's in center of Madrid that you can walk to all of the sights to be seen. there's bus, tour bus and underground stations near by along with lots of taxis of course. the restaurant is good and the staff friendly. maybe the only drawback here is that it's not that cheap (130 euros/night)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place if you are willing to pay for it”
Reviews.Author: E B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is stuning. Everything looks new and in a very good condition. The double rooms are simply amazing. The bathroom is big with all kind of facilities. The bed is probably the most comfortable bed I slept in in years. The hotel is silent, although as it is in the city centre of Madrid, you can hear some slight noises at some point. In short, the hotel is amazing and really comfortable. Ideal if you have/plan to spend a lot of time in your room. The breakfast buffet is very good with a lot of offer, and the bar offers a nice environment to chill out for a while (and get a mojito, they're really good).

Reviews.Title: “READ THIS BEFORE YOU BOOK - THEN GO ELSEWHERE”
Reviews.Author: sheepygold
Reviews.Content: I apologise for the length of this review but spending 5 minutes reading it may save you problems. My wife and I booked this hotel for 8 nights through an agent and pre-paid on arrival to secure the best rate. We left at 1am in the morning after staying just 3 nights. We are both seasoned travellers and we have NEVER left a hotel before during the middle of our stay. In the interests of a balanced review I will outline the GOOD points of this hotel. The buffet breakfast was excellent in terms of quality and variety. The beds we had were comfortable and the room was acceptably clean. The location of the hotel was very convenient. Now I will explain the BAD points. Firstly on arrival they did not have me listed on the booking which was a minor problem. Then they made a mistake on the charges which needed correcting - this was just a little annoying. When we tried to use the room safe we found it did not work so went to Reception who without checking assured us it did work but I was not using it properly. Eventually they sent a technician to our room who found that the batteries in the safe door needed replacing which is why it would not close. The safe worked for 1 day before failing to close and again the technician had to be called. Initially Reception insisted we wait in the room for the technician until I explained that the safe was empty and open at which point they relented and it was fixed. The next issue was that both the bedside lights did not work. Again we had to ask for the technician to come to fix them. As far as the room goes it was quite small and cluttered for two people for 8 days (I estimate about 200 square feet including bath and toilet) and it was badly designed with so many light switches that I was treated to a disco sensation every time my wife used the bathroom. Also they managed to squeeze in a desk and reclining chair which would have been good IF the room had been larger. The room had been refurbished within the last 2 or 3 years in my estimation but it was not done to a great standard and there was missing grout and some mould in the bathroom. Room facilites were limited. There was no kettle or even an alarm clock or a radio though there was a TV. There were 2 particularly annoying features. The internal soundproofing was awful so we could hear lots of noise from the rooms above and next to us especially the scraping of furniture as the floors were wooden. In addition we were 2 rooms away from the lift and when you were in bed you could clearly hear the lift bell at night. The other annoying feature was the fire detector / alarm which was located right above the bed and flashed brightly every 3 seconds. Luckily we always carry earplugs and eye masks so we could cope with these 2 issues. Also towels and toiletaries were not replaced 100 percent as they should have been. We picked this hotel for the pool. When we went to use it we were told it would cost Euro 15 for each of us per day. According to our travel agent the website does not tell you of this extra charge and I am told the hotel verbally admitted this but would not relent and allow us to use the facilities for free - although at the end they offered my wife one free day to use the pool facilities. All of the above is not good for a ´´5 star´¨ hotel but that is NOT why we left. On the fourth night we came back to our room at about 11pm and wanted a bath. The hot water ran brown (the cold seemed to be clear). It was not only brown but has scum on top and bits of detritus in. We called Reception who said let the bath run for a short time and it will go clear. We let it run for maybe 10 - 15 minutes and it was still brown so Reception sent up a technician who confirmed it was still brown! We asked Reception what the problem was. They came up with various answers such as it is a broken pipe outside and all the hotels in the area are affected (but if so why was the cold water running clear) but it became apparant that they just did not know. I asked if it was safe to use and they said absolutely it was. I then asked how could they say that it was safe if they did not know why it was happening. I also asked why they were not informing the guests and issuing bottled water - I was not given any answer to these 2 questions. We then asked to speak to the Duty Manager - AND WERE TOLD THAT THIS ¨¨5 STAR¨¨ 200+ BEDROOM HOTEL DOES NOT HAVE A MANGER AT NIGHT EVER!! (and this is standard in Spain!) and so the only person to deal with was the 23 year old (my guess) part-time student receptionist. The Manager (Fatima?) was at home and we awaited a call from her which never came. Eventually at midnight we asked for a refund for the 5 nights we had not used and we were told we had to wait until the Manager arrived in the morning. I said that the hotel now ought to call the police in to mediate as I was so unhappy and funnily enough within 2 or 3 minutes we had a refund and were able to leave!! I will try and tell Melia about this review and see what they have to say but we are now in a centrally located 5 star hotel paying about Euro 5 LESS a night with access to the business lounge and a 600 sq foot room. The other issue we found is that the staff we spoke to on Reception apart from 2 young girls spoke very little English - which is not what you expect for a so called ¨¨5 Star¨¨ hotel. They also had a really bad attitude apart from one tall slim blonde girl who spoke good English and was really helpful - but she was not there when we left.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back !”
Reviews.Author: therudies86
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in many hotels, but this one takes the cake in terms of thoughtful touches. I am guessing a few years ago the hotel was refurbished, and they did a great job. The staff were welcoming, friendly and very helpful. The breakfast buffet was superb - a coeliac freind whom I was travelling with was very happy to see some GF bread ! It is located in the city, but not the centre of the city. I am guessing there arent many places around Madrid that arent noisy (sirens, etc), but I was woken by some garbage trucks.

Reviews.Title: “good but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: varz_84
Reviews.Content: hotel is over all good. but rooms are very small.hotel is very well in the city. just opposite the hotel you get the tour bus for city tour. many indian restaurants near hotel. just opposite side of hotel a very big store named corte english is situated where you get all the stuff...

Reviews.Title: “great location, awesome amenities, impressive style & service”
Reviews.Author: whitflip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights on our honeymoon, and found it to be an excellent choice for exploring Madrid for the first time. The hotel is modern, spotless, and very beautiful. We splurged and bought a room in The Level program, which I highly recommend. For the extra cost, we got free entrance into the breakfast buffet (normally 26 euros each), spa/gym access, rooms on the 12th floor, impeccable customer service, and access to The Level's open bar/snack station all day and night. And yes, it really is an open bar. So great. Re: the breakfast buffet - it is extensive and definitely the kind of thing that would fill you up all day. Perfect for visiting before a day of walking/exploring. Re: the rooms - compared to your standard American hotel room in a strip mall or suburban land track, they are a bit on the small side. However, for a City hotel, I found them to be average in size. They are above-average in amenities, style, and comfort. The bed was so soft and the Melia pillow menu (i.e. any kind of pillow you could want) was AMAZING. Re: location - Very close to the Royal Palace, Plaza Mayor, Gran Via, etc. The metro is just a block away and very easy to navigate. We loved this hotel and would definitely come back. The staff were great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: stphnmcgwn
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been refurbished inside over the last couple of years. Room was modern, nice, clean, comfortable. Staff are friendly and helpful - as an English speaker with limited Spanish, the standard of English among staff was superb. One small criticism (I would say is common to a lot of hotels) - instructions on how to operate the showers would be useful. The shower iteself is great but took a while to figure out how to get it to work. Location is superb - quite close to main tourist areas. I've stayed here many times for work but this was the first time that I'd stayed for pleasure and had never realised that the main tourist areas were so close by (walking distance). Minutes away from a subway station so easy access to all of Madrid served by subway. Overall, great place to stay and a great base for exploring Madrid. Hotel is maybe a little on the expensive side is worth it when you factor in the fact that Gran Via and the main tourist areas are within walking distance and the subway is so close by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent reprieve from the maddening crowd”
Reviews.Author: raymondjames8
Reviews.Content: This 5-star hotel was a short walk up from Grand Via, but it was nice to get away from the hustle, bustle & noise. Located steps away from the Ventura Rodriguez Metro stop. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional. The rooms were modern and comfortable. There was good shopping nearby and some restaurants in the area. However, it's not a far walk to the Grand Via tourist area. Good experience. Would stay here again at the right price. We got this hotel in a bid on Expedia!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: RealTravelPro
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Great design, great location, great service. I love the rooms! They feel so cozy, the bed is very comfortable, the closet opening to the entrance as well as the bathroom is genius. I usually stay here for business but wouldn't book any other hotel for leisure as well.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, and superbly located”
Reviews.Author: f-hogan_25
Reviews.Content: Our large group was accomodated with the minimum of fuss and a great deal of care. Staff worked attentively throughout. We had the premium "Level" service.....with a discreet "free" bar and small snacks, and superb coffee from bean to cup in moments. Breakfast in the main restaurant was a delight for both quality and range of food, and service standards were superb. It's very handy for the centre: just a few mins walk to the Royal Palace, stopping by the Egyptian temple on the way, and the conscientious concierges had a hotline to the taxi rank should you need it. The premium room was spacious with modern tech (take a headphone to RCA if you want to play your Ipod through the TV), satellite TV, and, unusually for a Euro Hotel, Tea and Coffee making facilities in the room. Bed was very comfy, bathroom stylish and modern, and funky colour changing light tables by the bed helped give a nice ambience. Very happy to return here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: HANNAPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel last week. It's a very modern hotel, good location. The staff was very helpful. We booked the grand premium room - level service, which offers some small snacks till late evening,with open bar. The room was great, big enough by european standards. Walking distance to Plaza Espana -5 min, Plaza del Sol -about 15 min. Madrid bus tour stop is only 5 min away. Breakfest was excellent - much better quality than in US. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a 5 star experience do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: paul026
Reviews.Content: I was seriously disappointed with this hotel. I am glad that those who have contributed positive reviews enjoyed this facility. Alas it was not for me. By no stretch of the imagination can it be classified as 5 star. It has serious failings at many levels from poor service at front of house to room design flaws that made for an unpleasent few days. There are 2 types of room on the second floor of this hotel advertised and allocated as "PREMIUM" guests rooms. The first (a corner type room) in which I spent 3 nights was absolutely awful. It was cramped and uncomfortable. The room I stayed in (201) had serious design flaws. More later,but a word of genuine advice, if you do decide to stay here do not accept a corner room on this level. The second room on the same level which they allocated to me for the last night was far more acceptable. Had I been given this room at the beginning the review might be different however it was only on the last day after speaking to guests relations (excellent lady) did they accept that my concerns regarding both room and service and willingly changed rooms for me.. The first room was tacky and flawed in many ways. The wardrobe space was a joke and the lights within it kept coming on and off through the night. Whoever choose the sink units had an eye for optics as opposed to practicality and function. You cannot put both hands under the tap unless of course you are a small child. The whole bathroom design in my opinion was nickle and dime,looks in fact good but wont last. Which of course brings me to the issue of service or non service. On the first morning the shower never worked. I reported same. When I came back I still could not operate it. Was told the maintenence left a note. The whole service approach to the issue was of a poor standard. Not even in a youth hostel as a young man did I ever need a note to tell me how to operate a shower. In this corner type room there is no proper light over the bath/shower and you would need the vision of superman to distinguish between gel/shampoo/conditioner. If you want to read in bed forget it unless you bring your own torch. Again optics over function occupies the bed space. The lighting looks nice but you cant read.. To use the safe you have to get on your hands and knees to the bottom of the bedside locker were there is no light. However if you bring your torch, magnifying glass and knee pads you might just about manage it..Perhaps some might find this a little over the top. It is my honest experience. I spend approximately 70/80 nights a year away from home and usually in 5 star hotels. This is no 5 star hotel and is not the best of advertisements for standards that might apply across the Melia product. In a word. AWFUL So, what was good.. The bed was most comfortable,both rooms nicely serviced and cleaned, bathroom amenities plentiful and of a good quality. The location for seeing Madrid itself was also a plus and the Melia was within easy walking distance to some excellent restaurants on the Grand Via Plaza de Mayor and Sol districts. The metro is less than 2 minutes walk away. Would I return?? Most certainly not

Reviews.Title: “Could have been perfect if not service”
Reviews.Author: Lilind
Reviews.Content: I chosen this hotel based on the previous TripAdvisor recommendations for a combined business / family trip. Let's start with positive sides. Location is great close to major attractions and only steps away from Metro, which gives you easy access to everywhere in Madrid. It is also one of the very hotel in town that offers possibility of family rooms ( we travelled with 2 kids - 4 and 12 years old). I spent hours trying to find a family friendly room in Madrid for a reasonable price, but ended up with only choices offering 2 connecting rooms. Melia Princessa offers excellent family rooms with 2 additional beds , which is not common in this city! We also got excited about swimming pool and spa , as I knew i will have to work which gave family extra incentive to choose this place, however it turned out not to be so great. Pool is too deep for kids and too small for adults, spa is very small and as someone before pointed out lockers smells like a public bathrooms. Spa/pool staff is very unfriendly and shouts on kids when they talk too loud or you disturb them in they never-ending siesta while asking for towels. It was a disappointment. When it comes to room we decided to choose the Level experience. For some affordable extra $ - if you can afford it's very recommended as it gives you access to private lounge and services. Family room we stayed was very specious ( some 40 m2) and modern furbished. Comfortable king bed and smaller beds for kids. Bathroom with separate shower and bath/spa and even bidet. We tried in-room spa one day, but it takes forever to fill it up so we never used it since. Major disappointment comes regarding room service. Amenities were not refilled regularly, bin was not emptied , etc. We complained , but not much change in fact we observed more rude behaviour from room service, like giving us 20 bottles of bath gel, but not refilling water, etc. Hotel offers free WiFi service, but it does not work well in all rooms and is annoying as requires new code after 24 hours. There is a business centre in The Level lounge where you can use free access to internet and printer. The lounge offers limited snacks and drinks or a small breakfast during the week. I have not had a chance to try it during the week , but Sunday breakfast offered in main hall was amazing and one of the best parts of overall experience. Ice-machines are not available unfortunately , but you can get some from bar staff in the evening if you smile nicely to them ;) Overall we stayed a week and I would love to get back only if the service improves !

Reviews.Title: “Good choice of venue”
Reviews.Author: gjune
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself stayed for two nights. We booked the Premier room which included the Level service. Unfortunately, the Level lounge was closed all through August and did not reopen until the third of September. However we were very pleased with standard of room space, great bathrooms and cleanliness everywhere. The breakfasts were good and the staff were exceptionally helpful. Only negative point. Because of the good location of the hotel been close to the city. it was a little noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice.”
Reviews.Author: Brazil1703
Reviews.Content: It wasn’t very cheap but was a great choice. Very quite and calm, located just a few steps from the metro station. Very convenient. The room is very modern and comfortable. Good bathroom and perfect air conditioning. It offers free wi-fi and helpful staff. See the pictures for a better ideia.

Reviews.Title: “Cruise Group Agent at Transat Holidays”
Reviews.Author: Veronqiue Dube C
Reviews.Content: I visited Madrid for 2 nights and stayed at the Melia Madrid Princesa. The taxi cost was very cheap from the aiport to the hotel, less then 15 euros and the hotel is about 15-20 minutes away by car. The hotel is situated in a great area in Downtown Madrid. It is a very peaceful and great location. Right beside the hotel there is a street filles with Restaurants and bars/Tapas, its about a 5 minute walk to the beautiful parc Plaza Espana, where you see an amazing water fountain, you will also find the statues of Don Quijote de la mancha, a famous story in Spain written by Miguel de Cervantes. The lobby of the Melia Princesa hotel is exquisite, it is decorated with beautiful fresh white flowers that gives the area a sweet smell and a beautiful feeling. It is also decorated with Royal black and Gold furniture from the 17th century (if im not mistaken) but i know its very old. The rooms are very modern and spacious. The decorations is sublime, the rooms are white and Red and you have the choice to choose the color of preference for your night table. From orange to green from pink to blue. You make the choice. Its awesome! The bathrooms are superb, very spacious as well, the shower head makes the water seem as if your showering under a waterfall. The bathrooms provide everything you need for free. Shampoo, conditioner, shaving cream, shaver, tootbrush, tooth paste, body cream, hand soap. When your out of shampoo or anything else you just need to ask the personel and they will be happy to give you some more. The buffet in the morning is one of the best buffets i ate in. The variety and freshness of the food is amazing. The buffet literally has everything you think of for a morning breakfeast. I would be very surprise if someone wouldnt be staisfied with the buffet the Melia offers because its absoltely delicious. I highley reccomend this hotel, i really enjoyed my stay and will deffinatley consider this one to everyone that decides to make a trip in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: angela1969888
Reviews.Content: only one down side some nights very noisy, unfortunately our room 728 was situated next to lifts and can get very disturbed sleep! Breakfast very good could do with a little more organisation! Hotel bar more expensive than even Playa Mayor!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Hotel in every way”
Reviews.Author: LondonPoddy
Reviews.Content: My twin 18 yr old girls and I stayed there for 4 nights in July 2011 in Room 211. It is just 5 minutes to the main shops and cinema and theatres (we saw Swan Lake ballet in 10 minute walk from hotel) but far enough away to be quiet. A cheap grocery shop and a Metro stations within one minutes walk. We had twin bed for the girls and I had a foldaway but it was comfortable enough and I am 60 and the room is easily big enough. Bathroom was superb modern (great for the girls with good quality conditioners, soap etc), rain shower in bath, room with silent air-conditioning. More than enough plugs in room. The TV has every input possible in a special unit, as well as a DVD player. Breakfast is top quality, huge variety and your made-to-order omelette of course. We did not have dinner there but we met the chef who told me that made to order paella was 20 Euro each which is very reasonable considering the prices outside. Coffee in the room but no milk! The free WiFi in the room was bit temperamental dropping the signal but it is a big hotel. Finally, the front of house staff were superb. They spoke perfect English, no lining up, did not try to sell me anything, and genuinely enjoyed their job setting a gold standard in customer care!!! This is very important, because English speaking people seem to be rare in Madrid and the taxi drivers are shockers compared to other cities and having a safe home-base was important to us. Definitely one of the best city breaks I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Msknights
Reviews.Content: We planned our trip very poorly and ended up staying at the Melia Princessa three different times for one or two days during our trip (live and learn). The Melia was a very solid choice for our stay in Madrid. We loved the staff and food in the hotel lounge. The staff was friendly and remembered our orders each time. The front desk staff was hit or miss. There was a man that was not helpful nor friendly but, the ladies working the front desk were helpful and kind. The only access to the concierge was by paying to stay on The Level, which we did not do. The front desk staff was helpful in suggesting restaurants and helping us with directions. The rooms were very clean and well appointed. We had one fantastic view and two pretty poor views. The location was a bit of a walk from the "tourist" part of town. It took 30-40 minutes to walk to the historic or touristy areas but, it was safe. The hotel is a 30-40 minute taxi ride or a 40 minute train commute. We took the train and it was fantastic. Clean, cheap and easy to use to get back and forth from the airport. I contacted the hotel and they provided directions for using the train to arrive. The food in the hotel restaurants was very expensive. The restaurant for dinner had just ok food and was over 100 euros for my daughter and I to eat dinner. The breakfast restaurant was about $20 euros for the buffett. Pretty good food but, way overpriced. I would absolutely stay at the Melia again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: rizadoManchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed four days in this hotel in July 2011 and were very impressed. The hotel is very smart and the rooms spacious and modern, with a king sized bed.The staff were courteous, helpul and friendly.The hotel has a great position near to the Plaza Espana, yards away from the nearest metro, Ventura Rodriguez. The only problem we had (which was rectified by the staff without too much trouble) was that we booked with Lastminute.com, and the booking included free breakfast. However the hotel for some reason were not aware of this. Luckily I had my paperwork with me and the hotel honoured my booking terms. The breakfast was excellent, fruit and full English. Madrid is a beautiful city and there was plenty to do both day and night. I must mention the Mercado San Miguel, a beautiful glass and steel construction slleing all types of tapas and drinks, a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis for the weary traveller”
Reviews.Author: Glendyrr
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel.We were bumped of our Iberia flight and had to stay here one night only.Although we only checked in at 22h30 ,there were an amazing buffet awating us with complimentary spanish red wine (propably with coutesy of Iberia!).The rooms were comfortable ,and the food amazing.Here is had the best meal in 8 weeks after a study tour .Keep us the good work and service.

Reviews.Title: “'Spa' in the loosest sense of the word.”
Reviews.Author: Vixtah76
Reviews.Content: Don't make the mistake, as we did, of thinking "great, there's a spa, we'll spend a few hours in there relaxing". Dingey, dark pool area. Very small pool. Two loungers. Locker room similar to public baths, with similar smell. Questionable jacuzzi bath, shabby steam room. We didnt go in the sauna. The guy who was working in there came to sit beside us while we were on the loungers and proceeded to start eating a baguette, then told us off for not showering immediately after the steamroom. By then, we had decided to leave. We stayed for about 20 mins. So not relaxing, so not a 'spa'.We complained and were told that the 'spa' is run by a different company to the hotel. But they did give us our €15 back. Apart from that. Great location. Room small but nice and clean. Lobby and bar sparkly. Breakfast room dated but buffet good.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location BUT QUESTIONABLE Hotel Service”
Reviews.Author: RonnieHongKong
Reviews.Content: The location is superb and is only a minute walk from the Metro station (Ventura Rodriez) to the hotel. The lady at the reception counter spoke very good English. Her service was good and arranged a room on 11/Fl with very good view for us. The room is clean and decent. Based on this good experience, we approached another lady staff at the reception counter the next morning and asked her where could we buy ticket for the 'Bull-fight'. She told us that we would not be able to buy the tickets ourselves but the Hotel could assist us throught an agent and we would have to pay A BIT MORE for the tickets. She told us it would be at the cost of Euro $60 for each ticket'. We bought 2 tickets at a total price of Euro$120. Upon receiving the tickets, we were shocked to find that each ticket actually costed Euro $30!! Instead of charging us 'a bit more', the hotel/agent actually overcharged us 100%!! We were VERY DISAPPOINTED about the so-called service of the hotel and the lady receptionist should have told us that we would be charged 100% more for each ticket. We later approached the Tourist Information Centre at downtown which told us the address where we could buy 'bull-fight' tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to chill out”
Reviews.Author: tiggerwoods
Reviews.Content: We only used the Melia for one night at the end of our short break to Madrid. We booked a Grand Premium Room, which has a large bedroom and very large bathroom. Good views over the City from both. We had use of "The Level" which means that drinks and snacks are provided. Good selection of booze (although the Baileys had run out). Plenty of crisps and hors d'oeuvres - the latter aren't labelled so it is not always easy to tell what they are (nuisance if you are a veggie). We were kept waiting to check in, but at least we could have a drink and something to eat before getting into our room. BTW The Level is just a few steps up from reception - not near the room. The hotel is near the Temple of Debod which needs to be seen during the day and after dark and the Plaza España. The hotel has a pool and gym. The latter looked well fitted out but we didn't use it. The pool is tiny and they made you wear a stupid hat which does really cover much of peoples hair. There is a steam room and sauna as well.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Manuel P
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK, not surprising not magic. However has anexcellent location close to the subway

Reviews.Title: “Swimming pool sundays closed”
Reviews.Author: muctim
Reviews.Content: This is not a four star rating when gym and swimming pool are closed the whole sunday. Alltogether this hotel might be a good three star hotel. Little things are missing: Coffeemaker in the room? Yes, but milk? No milk. Who wants milk in the coffee? Also the service is not what you would expect in a four star rated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Try and stay on the Level”
Reviews.Author: Grant D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two enjoyable days courtesy of a 2 nights for 1 birthday offer from SolMelia which cost us only 255 euros to stay on the Level, The Level has its own separate check-in and Celia was most helpful throughout our atay. The Level has its own separate 12th Floor and is open only for Monday to Friday stays. The room was very modernistic with beautiful light effects and also work stations for the laptop. The bonuses to stay on the Level included free entrance to the Spa (not worth 17 euros a head otherwise), free wi-fi internet and a free full breakfast in the first floor restaurant. With the level you also have your own very comfortable lounge where from 11.00-23.00 drinks (wine, beer, spirits, soft drinks - everything) are completely free and also tapas and small cakes are always available. The breakfast while fine was a bit more like what you would expext in a 3 rather than a five star hotel. Service at the hotel was excellent with all the staff unfailingly helpful and polite. The hotel's location is excellent being a short walk to the Sol district and with a metro station right outside. Parking is difficult in the area but there is an underground car park at 24 euros per day right beside the hotel. We would certainly stay here again if we got another good deal but not at the normal rates of around 210 euros a night for a standard room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel, excellent breakfast and beds, but some issues”
Reviews.Author: MadAmerican
Reviews.Content: Spent a couple of nights in Madrid for a concert and chose another hotel from the Melia chain, my favourite when I’m travelling around Spain. As I have one of their MaS cards, I usually receive offers and email alerts, and this time the opportunity was too good to let it go: two nights for the price of one, bed and breakfast. I chose the Melia Princesa out of convenience, actually, since it was relatively close to the concert venue. Of course, it being a 5 stars hotel was also taken into account... The offer did not give us opportunity to choose the kind of room we wanted, so we had to settle for a standard. It was quite all right, though: big enough, modern furniture (with form over function at times, though: see the review where the guest complained about the shape of the faucets, spot on!!), king bed, nice and spacious bathroom with bathtub and shower... I think we were upgraded to one of the rooms on the top floors, since standard rooms don't often come with a view in the Melia chain, and ours had a nice one. Another advantage of the MaS card! Buffet Breakfast was included in the price and was excellent, as is usually the trend with this chain. Of course, this time it was up to the hotel’s standard: fresh orange juice, ready made eggs, ready made pancakes... lots of meats (cold and hot) to choose from, smoked cod, smoked salmon, lots of fruits and such a wide range of food in general I didn't know where to start! However, not everything was as good. I tend to rate hotels in TA according to my level of satisfaction, but also taking into account the category of the hotel. I had a just as good experience in the 3-stars hotel I stayed in when in Valencia, and a better one in the 4-stars hotel in Seville. In Melia Princesa, the room was clean but the walls were worn out, stained and chipped in some places; there was only one bathrobe and a pair of slippers in the room, even though they knew well in advance that we were two people; My mobile phone run out of power and they couldn’t provide me with a common and simple Nokia charger... while in the 3-stars hotel in Valencia they had a counter in the hall with several kinds of chargers for every brand. Customer service was cold at best: 5 stars should mean something more than just having a bellman to take your luggage to your room, I can do that myself, but I expect a kinder welcome in general. Smiling doesn’t hurt! This doesn't apply to the staff in the restaurant, however, who were all very nice and polite at all times. The pros beat the cons anyway, and we had a pleasant stay as the bed was very comfy and, as I said, breakfast was excellent and the rates unbeatable. I tend to go to Madrid some times a year, so I think I will give this hotel another opportunity and next time I'll go for one of the premium rooms if I can.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great Loacation”
Reviews.Author: CamLovesSun
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights combining my husbands business with my pleasure. The staff were friendly and very helpful with restaurant recommendations and directions. The room was modern, clean bright with good decor, the bed was very comfy and internet was fast. The hotel is a great location moments away from the metro or walking distance from shops. The breakfast was very good and the bar was a nice place to meet in the evening before dinner. We would definitely stay there again when in Madrid. It is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, centrally located, good service”
Reviews.Author: flam18
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 2 nights and liked the stay. The hotel is just 10-15 min walk from Gran Via the major shopping and entertainment district of Madrid. The hotel itself is located on a busy street so conveyance is not a problem and supermarkets and many restaurants are right on the doorstep. We took the Guest Level Room which had special check-in desk and some extra services, including one free service at the spa. However, the day we reached it was closed and we paid for nothing. They checked us in in the normal reception area and spa was also not available. So that was a waste. But otherwise the rooms were good, not very spacious but decently decorated with plush-looking interiors. Bathroom was good and they provided Etro toiletories. Service was good, the housekeeping shuts in the night, but we needed some stuff and the staff happily helped us. Overall would recommend this hotel, has good interiors and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, good sleep, beautiful, great location, tasty breakfast”
Reviews.Author: adar
Reviews.Content: Other hotels in Madrid must be fantastic if this hotel did not make it to the top 10. I had a great time there last week. The first thing you notice is that the design is very modern, both in the lobby and in the rooms. While some people may find it "different" I found it a refreshing change from the standard chain business hotels. The room was very well equipped and very quiet. I do not know how they succeed in making it so quiet when the location is so central. Reception people were particularly friendly and did not hesitate to give recommendations on where to go and how to get there. Breakfast is great - my favorites were the paella and the fresh cheese. The location is at one extreme of the center. On my day off I took the metro (which is fantastic) to the other extreme to begin my explorations slowly making my way back by foot, ending back at the hotel in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ANGELA,GREECE
Reviews.Content: We arrive in Madrid late at night and took a taxi to the hotel when we arrive a friendly member of the staff arranged our check in . when we booked we requested a non smoking room in a high floor our room was non smoking but on the second floor , we didn't mind , the room was really nice and modern and had a gread bathroom and a huge and comfortable bed :) we wake up the other day in the morning had breakfast (really good) and took a taxi to the royal palace (it was only 10 minites walk but we didn't know). after a great day out in the city we did find out that the Madrid hop on hop off bus have a stop just 150meter away from the hotel . we used the indoor pool that was really relaxing after a long day out in this beautiful city

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, steps from Metro”
Reviews.Author: marlonfl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Melia Princese twice during my trip to Spain. It is a great hotel, good location and service. Breakfast and Hotel Restaurant are great as well. The hotel also scored high in 2 very important items for me: 1- great bed. 2 - great shower. The location as good; you could take the Metro (Ventura Rodriguez) or walk to Plaza de Espana or even Portal de Sol (20 min walking). You have a lot of options of restaurants around as well.

Reviews.Title: “COSTLY BUT WORTH”
Reviews.Author: Shivang5
Reviews.Content: A really good experience for stay at the hotel. I stayed for 10 days. Really nice breakfast and ambience. 30 min from airport and 15 min by walking from the central square in madrid. Also can do a very cheap shopping from nearby places.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: lindsay48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon, and it was absolutely amazing. Fabulous rooms- very chic and functional! Location- perfect! right near many subway lines. the front desk is super helpful with helping you find whatever you need.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: PharmaTraveller
Reviews.Content: I spent just a single night at the Melia Madrid Princesa on my way back home from South America. Having been my first trip to Madrid I was happy for a hotel in a really central area, only 10 minutes walk from the Gran Via, the Palace, Plaza Espana and only a bit more to Plaza Mayor and Puerto del Sol. The hotel itself is pretty and very appealing. A great deal of attention was given to decor both of rooms and public areas. A great mixture of boutique, art and high-tech. A very Spanish ambience that I like. Breakfast on the first floor was rich and plentiful. I didn't get the chance to see the fitness facility or pool but they are there. Internet WiFi connection was weak in the lobby but the connection (called "hotel") was free and I honestly did not try to improve it so there may have been a way. I was sorry to spend only one night there and I will surely look at the Melia Madrid Princesa on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Acquired taste!”
Reviews.Author: poppyfield17
Reviews.Content: Very strong interior design which now looks dated. Rooms small but spotlessly clean. Lighting can only be described as subdued. Would have helped to have had more wardrobe space ( we were there for three nights) Breakfast excellent. Bar area small and nowhere for non smokers to sit. Had to sit with smokers. Staff attentive and friendly. Very close to metro stop which made travel around city quick and easy. We did use the safe in the room but needed to ask Reception for instructions how to operate it as info in the room not adequate. Found it difficult to find decent restaurants in the area in order to eat in the evenings. A lot of money for not a lot in return!

Reviews.Title: “MONEY STOLEN FROM LUGGAGE IN ROOM!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mols0n
Reviews.Content: This was the last portion of our stay following an extensively planned European trip. The experience here ABSOLUTELY RUINED the final touches of our trip. Despite being a little under the weather from a flight from Rome we stayed in the room the first night to recover from a flu bug. The walls are paper thin and we had a terrible sleep. We could not figure out the safe, and our shower did not work. We only had petty cash on us. When we were able to go out and explore the city I came back to our room in the late evening Sunday night only to find that my luggage had been rummaged through and some of my money was missing from my travel-wallet (which was hidden in a booksleeve and wrapped in a beach towel within the luggage with a decoy wallet placed in my backpack across the room.) The front desk clerk advised they would notify the manager the following morning. The caretaker printed out the room -key log indicating that only the cleaner had entered after we left the room. Who else could have taken some of my cash?? I am completely of the mind that if you are foolish with your $ you deserve to have it stolen but at a so-called 5* hotel I shouldn't have to worry if I leave some petty cash hidden within my luggage... the female manager (still too sick to remember her name) tried to remedy the situation with an offering of a voucher of some sort (possibly food?) but then advised because I had booked my stay at Hotel Meliá Madrid Princesa through Hotwire she could not extend a voucher. To then dismiss the theft issue and reiterating how I booked the hotel is unacceptable! To not even apologize for the loss really pissed me off. I don't care about the amount that was stolen, but to condone petty thievery amongst the Melia staff and to not fully listen to why I was upset over the loss and just offer me an upgrade if I comeback to any Melia hotel is PATHETIC. Thank you for ruining Madrid for us!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location,”
Reviews.Author: Havanaguy
Reviews.Content: Pros Free internet Subway station right in the corner Very close to Royal Palace and many other touristic attractions. Good service There is a big store El Corte Ingles nearby, where you can find a supermarket, a pharmacy etc, very convenient. Cons Charge of 17 E every time you use the pool. Small Gym It does not look like a 5 * Hotel, maybe 4

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't impressed...”
Reviews.Author: GABuckeye
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in the hotel overall as this place did not resemble a 5-star hotel. The staff was not helpful and at times rude. The bar was outrageous considering where it was located in Madrid. The room was super contemporary. If you are there for sightseeing, there are a lot of hotels that are much more convenient in Madrid. Maybe best for business travelers. The morning we were checking out, a "hotel taxi" mysteriously arrived just as we were leaving for the airport. The bellman told us it was a "similar" price to a taxi but was so much better. Nice it was, but it wasn't worth the additional 12 Euros that it cost us.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: shabbat18
Reviews.Content: We checked into this "so called" 5 star hotel. We left to eat and when we returned found everything in our room stolen....passports, cash, our kids laptops, ipods, our camera, cellular phone, etc. $15,000.00 loss.. The hotel did no investigation. The police did not question anyone in the hotel and there were no security cameras. This was clearly an inside job. In the end the hotel does not want to take responsibility and was very cold in the matter. We prepaid 3 nights and only stayed 2 and the hotel would not even reimburse us the last night. My kids were frightened knowing that someone entered our room and got away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Isidore
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Beautiful rooms, elegant decor, considerabkle comfort and helpful staff. I only had breakfast tere but I found the choice available for it excellent. The location is within reasonable walking distance of all teh sights of Central Madrid. Strongly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: smileymileysydney
Reviews.Content: Travelled with work but had the opportunity to stay over for the weekend. Hotel was better than expected. Rooms were spacious and the bed and pillows awsome! Service was superb and friendly. Location was good, you can walk into the main tourist areas in 10-20 mins or if you are lazy, for 1 Euro you can take a train from right outside a few stops to where you want to go. Some people commented about the noise. I had a level 2 room with a window on the main street. It was a little noisy but you are in central madrid......close the window and get over it! Shame you have to pay extra to use the pool too!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TtravellerUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Level which was well worth the extra cost. Note: The Level is not open weekends which is odd. Got stuck in Madrid due to Volcano disruption. Staff in The Level were helpful but had limited knowledge of options of how to get out of Madrid. Free Internet was great but at 11.00pm access stopped (as it was Friday) and we then had to pay which was annoying due to the extreme circumstances. Breakfast was fantastic - good choice and great atmosphere. Location of hotel was good - about 15/20 minute walk to the main areas. Rained the whole time which was a bit disappointing. I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: EJGMIA
Reviews.Content: We had previously stayed at this hotel but had not visited in a while. The hotel has been completely redone and is now modern and convenient. We stayed at The Level, which is an area of the hotel, next to the meeting rooms, that has been converted into mini junior suites, these are small but quite confortable and at a very reasonable rate. The hotel location is quite convenient to Gran Via, Plaza Mayor and La Puerta del Sol, all within walking distance. The only complaint I have is with decor taking precedent over functionality, it appears like ergonomics is not taught in design schooll in Spain! Some of the bathroom fixtures are not functional, like the double sinks and the water leaking out of the glass enclosed shower.The bar/restaurant operation is good.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Norwegianvagabond
Reviews.Content: Good and clean rooms. Nice entrance Central location Didnt bring my laptop and it was expensive to use the PC in the reception Not consistant the service level that you would expect in a 5 star The pool and spa was not a 5 star. Gym - good machines.

Reviews.Title: “It's such a good choise for a stay in Madrid!”
Reviews.Author: Th0mas_L0nd0n
Reviews.Content: Well, before booking a reservation in this hotel, I first read some reviews in here. I really enjoyed all I did in this amazing city because we were lucky to choose this hotel. It's in central Madrid. You've got Metro station just 2 minutes walking, but you can do almost everything walking in this location. The lobby is so comfortable and the members of staffs are so helpful at all times you need. I'm happy to recommend that to everyone. Have a good fum in Madrid!!;-)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, central location, modern rooms with nice bathrooms. Not amazing but good.”
Reviews.Author: bettiblu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Melia Madrid Princesa for a long weekend in March. The hotel entrance is down an uninspiring alleway off C/Princesa - very close to the Metro (less than 50m). The location is very central so you could walk everywhere - we used the Metro a bit because it was such a rainy weekend. The lobby has a slightly Asian theme and is pleasant enough. Service at reception is a bit slow but friendly when they get around to you. Rooms are city-sized and modern. Ours was on the 7th floor, clean and compact with a comfortable bed. The bathroom is nice - double sinks and a big bath with powerful shower. Slightly odd arrangement with the storage space being between the bathroom and the corridor with some automated lighting features but otherwise good. Madrid is a noisy city and we could hear people / road noise from the 7th floor but it did not trouble us too much. It is not an amazing 5* experience but it is a good centrally located, recently refurbished hotel. Worth considering for a weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Locations”
Reviews.Author: Baja78
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel if you want to visit Madrid, it is very central and you do have a subway just 1 minute walking distance. Fantastic breakfast and very confortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Crisinmiami
Reviews.Content: I am at this hotel right now. I had to get back on TripAdvisor because I am so shocked at how low this property is rated. For starters - the rooms are impeccably clean, amazing tubs - I asked for a King Size Bed and No Smoking Room - it's quiet, recently refurbished, free wireless internet service, modern rooms. We had an issue with the keycards which didn't work and they upgraded us from a standard froom to a "Grand Premium" room to compensate us for our troubles. Every single hotel employee has been extremely courteous and accommodating. This new room has a jacuzzi with an amazing view - very romantic, robes - the works - this truly feels 5 star (I should have booked this room to start with). You can walk to just about anything and the train is practically at the hotel door - it cost us 2 Euros each to get here from the airport (make sure you have change since machines at airport don't take large bills) - metro is super easy to use and safe. There are so many places to eat and shop within 5 mins of hotel... I have been to Madrid many times but this is by far the best trip I've ever had. It's raining now and we are on our way to the indoor pool and to use spa facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Shocked - I am impressed!”
Reviews.Author: vegasflyer
Reviews.Content: A self-described hotel snob, I did not expect much from this place, especially for the price. I found the service to be professional yet welcoming and the room extremely comfortable and well-laid out (for its size). Curious about the upgrade to "The Level" club floor (only 33 Euros/day, incl. breakfast, lunch on weekdays, cocktails, evening appetizers, and use of spa). Seems like a tremendous value, considering the lunch set menu was nearly 20 Euros/person in the hotel restaurant. Reception said the Level rooms are exactly the same layout and amenities as standard rooms, however. Lunch at Uno (lobby restaurant) was ok, and service was congenial, however watching the server continually pick his hair and nose was a little too much. I am a Starwood junkie, but would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kwjnewman
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel: lovely rooms, great design, bed was amazingly comfortable, pool and spa fantastic. Only one criticism: get an interior room. The noise from outside, when staying in an exterior room, is a bit too much. Overall, though, a quality hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Modern, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: atltravelm0m
Reviews.Content: My family and I really enjoyed our stay here. This is a large hotel that seems like it may cater to the business crowd. The rooms were nicely appointed and made good use of a rather small space. My teenagers loved the “cool” factor of the modern rooms. (They had a separate room since there were only double rooms available.) Everything seemed new and very clean. The beds were extremely comfortable with the option of choosing the type pillow you wanted. The bathroom had a double vanity with vessel sinks (which I found to be somewhat awkward, but looked nice). The sink area was separate from the bath area. The bathroom had a combination shower/tub and a toilet, bidet, phone and towel warmer. There was plenty of storage for our clothes. There was free wireless internet- huge plus in our opinion. We booked this hotel through a “blind booking” service, so we received a great rate and were pleasantly surprised at the terrific location for touring Madrid. It was in a safe area and there was plenty of shopping and small eating establishments around. We avoid the added cost of minibars when we travel, so we were pleased there was a little store right around the corner for snacks and drinks. This worked fine for us. The staff seemed very accommodating and spoke English. We primarily used the hotel for sleeping while touring the city, so I cannot comment of the other amenities of the hotel, such as the pool or the restaurant. Would definitely like to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent comfort and location”
Reviews.Author: BulawayoZimtraveller
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, and I am genuinely mystified by the negative criticisms of some other contributors. I urge you not to be put off by them (as I nearly was). I stayed in the Melia Madrid Princesa twice during a recent trip to Europe, and this was easily the best of several hotels in which I stayed. It offered everything I was looking for. The situation is very convenient, and literally only a minute or two's walk from the Metro. The staff were smiling, friendly and efficient. The bedroom and bathroom were extremely well appointed (though it is true that the lighting scheme is a little eccentric). The bed was excptionally comfortable, and I slept very well. The breakfast was huge and varied, and very good value as long as you book it at the time that you check in, for a reduced price. I didn't need much for lunch as a result. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Yuck”
Reviews.Author: aef9892
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here, this is definitely not a 5 star, more like a 2-3 star. Way overpriced for what you get. Hotel is in need of a major remodel. Rooms are straight out of 1980's Las Vegas. Super ugly interior design and our room was tiny! but on a good note, the bed was comfy. WARNING: Hotel photos on website look nothing like how the rooms really look. We stayed on the 10th floor but could still hear noise of busy street below. Hated the location. No free breakfast and no wi-fi in room, only an ethernet cable. Stay at a Room Mate Oscar or Alicia instead. Much better location, free breakfast and wi-fi!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: tania_1515
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at this hotel for one night and found a secret hotel deal on Last minute. The rooms are very nice however we have just gone down to use the swimming pool advertised on their website as a service so assummed this was part of the package. When we got there we were informed we would have to pay 15 euros each. This hotel is already very expensive so think it is rediculous that this is not included. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Madrid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flights0ffancy
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel on line from Canada so was not sure of what to expect. Arrived early and were pleasantly met by friendly staff and booking in early was not a problem. Found the room to be exceptionally clean and modern. The design of the room was efficient as the small space was expertly used. Flat screen TV with CNN in English. The bathroom was well appointed with two shower heads and sufficient toiletries. Hallways and hotel lobby smartly decorated and pleasing to the eyes. A short walk to the subway which is very easy to use. About a 20 minute walk to Playa Mayor. Staff were friendly and helpful, except gave us the wrong information - Monday most museums and art galleries are closed. Not a lot of restaurants and bars in the area. Did not eat in the hotel - wanted to experience the local places for breakfast, etc. Would recommend this hotel for business travelers, friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: TXUKGal
